page.title: 17Recreation
page.content: There is quite a lot for entertainment about Chesterton. There are pubs which are used by people over eighteen as a place to meet with friends and have a drink, usually alcoholic. Clubs are just a bigger version of pubs with more room and children are allowed in. For children there is a youth club and disco which has a games room. These places are usually open at night and so is a bingo hall where people go to waste a small amount of money hoping to win more by ticking the numbers off on a ticket. In the day there is a swimming pool and sports hall belonging to the High School. Every summer there is an annual carnival which starts with a parade, a troupe display and the local Boys Brigade Band. Floats are decorated with flowers and streamers.
